intro: Struthanthus trujilloi, commonly known as the Trujillo's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb characterized by its succulent stems and orb-shaped clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually small, fleshy, and arranged oppositely along the stems. Struthanthus trujilloi is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms and often hairy foliage.
